intro: Hearnia aquatica, commonly known as the aquatic hearnia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its ability to store water in its thick leaves allows it to survive in fluctuating water levels. Hearnia aquatica is often used in ornamental gardening for its unique appearance and adaptability to aquatic conditions.
